Understate: The claim understates the fact that eliminating ICE would not eliminate border enforcement, as border security is the responsibility of Customs and Border Protection (CBP).
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that eliminating ICE would automatically mean eliminating border enforcement, which is a problematic assumption as it overlooks the role of CBP.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that eliminating ICE would eliminate border enforcement.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that eliminating ICE would not impact border enforcement because it falls under the jurisdiction of CBP.
